fr.laple.extensions.plugins

Class PluginConfigFileParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.laple.extensions.plugins.PluginConfigFileParser
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FeaturePluginConfigFileParser, LanguagePluginConfigFileParser

    public abstract class PluginConfigFileParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is an abstract class managing the parsing of plugin config files
    Author:
    anthonyrey

    • Constructor Detail

      • PluginConfigFileParser

        public PluginConfigFileParser(java.lang.String resourcePath,
                              java.lang.String configFile,
                              PluginConfigFileParser.PluginType pluginType)
                       throws PluginLoadingFatalException
        Constructor for the PluginConfigFIleParser The class is abstract so you need to instanciate a FeaturePluginConfigFileParser or LanguagePluginConfigFileParser
        Parameters:
        resourcePath - The path to the resource folder
        configFile - The path to the config file
        pluginType - The plugin type
        Throws:
        PluginLoadingFatalException - If there is any error
        See Also:
        FeaturePluginConfigFileParser, LanguagePluginConfigFileParser

    • Method Detail

      • createFileIfNotExist

        private void createFileIfNotExist()
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  PluginLoadingFatalException
        Create the config file if it does not exist
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is any problem with the IO
        PluginLoadingFatalException - If there is any other issue

      • addPlugin

        public IPlugin addPlugin(java.io.File file)
                  throws PluginLoadingException,
                         PluginLoadingFatalException,
                         PluginTypeException
        Add a plugin te the config file
        Parameters:
        file - The file of the plugin
        Returns:
        The loaded plugin
        Throws:
        PluginLoadingException - if non fatal error
        PluginLoadingFatalException - if fatal error
        PluginTypeException - if wrong type

      • removePlugin

        public void removePlugin(IPlugin plugin)
                  throws PluginLoadingException
        Remove the specified plugin
        Parameters:
        plugin - The plugin to remove
        Throws:
        PluginLoadingException - If could not remove

        public IPlugin getPlugin(IPlugin chosen,
                         boolean withData)
                  throws PluginLoadingException,
                         PluginLoadingFatalException,
                         PluginTypeException
        Get the plugin from a dummy (or another plugin even if useless)
        Parameters:
        chosen - The dummy
        withData - Do you want the plugin with data or another dummy ?
        Returns:
        The plugin
        Throws:
        PluginLoadingException
        PluginLoadingFatalException
        PluginTypeException - If the type is wrong
